dataset_name: WLASL - Word-Level American Sign Language Index
source: WLASL (Word-Level American Sign Language) dataset - Dongxu Li et al., WACV 2020

fields.gloss: English word or phrase (ASL gloss) that the sign represents (e.g., 'book', 'drink')
fields.instances: JSON array of video instances for this sign, each containing:
fields.instances[].bbox: Bounding box coordinates [x1, y1, x2, y2] for the signer in the video frame
fields.instances[].frame_end: End frame of the sign (-1 indicates full video)
fields.instances[].instance_id: Unique identifier for this video instance
fields.instances[].signer_id: Identifier for the person performing the sign
fields.instances[].source: Video source (aslbrick, aslsignbank, aslpro, handspeak, signingsavvy, etc.)
fields.instances[].split: Dataset split: train, val, or test

notes: Index of 2,000 ASL sign glosses with multiple video instances per gloss sourced from various ASL video repositories. Each gloss has multiple video examples showing different signers and variations. Video sources include ASL Signbank (Yale), ASL Pro, Handspeak, Signing Savvy, ASL University, and others. Used for sign language recognition research and accessibility visualization.
